content:
Incorrect. The print dialog has three options, List, Week, Month Only the Week option allows for changing dates, but each start date is a Monday and each end date is a Sunday. There is no way to print a single day.

Completely unacceptable

Also, completely unacceptable sending emails from no-reply@mozilla.org
creator: terry8

content:
General background info which might work for you:

In Windows 10 , 'Settings' > 'Ease of Access', there is 'Automatically hide scrollbars in Windows' option - it might be switched on, so switch it off. This should also force the Firefox browser scrollbars to stay visible. But that is a general Windows OS setting.

Also check the 'Registry Editor' - In windows bottom serch type: Registry Select: 'Registry Editor' You may asked permission to proceed. Navigate to this location: Computer\HKEY_CURRENT_USER\Control Panel\Desktop\WindowMetrics

Look for these two lines: 'ScrollHeight' and 'ScrollWidth', By default, they may have this negative number: -252 I had the scrollwidth and scrollheight set to: -255

To alter a number: Double click on the word 'ScrollHeight' and it opens a small window. It will say 'Value data:' and this is where you remove the contents and then type in a suitable negative number. You might need to enter: -255 or if you already see a number simlilar to that try something larger such as: -360 Then click on 'OK' Whatever you set for ScrollHeight', you need to also set up for 'ScrollWidth'.

But in Thunderbird, you may want to set this up with specific control: In Thunderbird.

  • Settings > General
  • Scroll to bottom and click on 'Config Editor' button

It opens in a new tab

  • In top search area type: scrollbar.
  • Look for the following 3 lines (as numbered below) and edit them.

1. 'widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.size.override' - change number to eg: 50 (you can modify this a suitable size ) 2. 'widget.non-native-theme.scrollbar.style' - change number to 4 3. 'widget.non-native-theme.win.scrollbar.use-system-size' - toggle to say 'false'

  • To edit a number click on the 'pencil' icon
  • Change number and then click on the 'tick' icon to save
  • To toggle from true to false - clickon the far right toggle icon

Once you have those three set up, you can then alter the first one to find a suitable size. On my computer 20 was ok, but it all depends upon what screen resolution and scaling you are using.
creator: Toad-Hall

content:
Two upfront thoughts: - if gmail account, removing subscription to allmail will reduce significantly - check in profile folder for account to see if any files labled NSTMP.... if so, those represent failed compactions and can be deleted.

For more suggestions, posting screenshot of account's folder in imapmail\<accountname> may prove helpful. Thank you

content:
John,

I'm on Windows 7 pro...almost the same issue, just began this morning.

I can receive, but every time I try to send, I get a message "RETRY or NEW PASSWORD NEEDED" or something to that effect.

I restored the system about an hour ago (to June 11 - prior to the latest Windows Update on MY system...which are NOT AUTOMATIC on my system).

It seems to be going SLOW...but at least it is sending now without the message.

I suspect (but am NO expert) that the latest Windows updates (2nd Tues of each month) threw Tbird for a loop.

Since I do NOT have my system set to automatically install those updates, my system only updated yesterday.

Hope this helps...

PS I've noticed in the past - when these Windows updates come out, it's generally best not to invest too much time reconfiguring Tbird until they've (MOZILLA) had a couple days to mess with it. Just my opinion.
creator: dmcalvert

content:
I think your friend is suggesting you create a mailing list of your recipients, and in that case you're only limited by the number allowed by the mail provider, typically 100. The gmail term for TB's mailing list is 'label'. Create a new mailing list by clicking the icon next to the New Contact button in Address Book, name it and close it, then add contacts from the address book by drag and drop onto the list icon.

http://kb.mozillazine.org/Thunderbird_:_FAQs_:_Create_Mailing_List

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/how-create-and-use-mailing-lists-thunderbird
creator: sfhowes

content: If this is an IMAP account, you might check with your email provider, as they may have a policy on duration of trash.
